name: Ivan Ramen
address: 25 Clinton St, New York, NY 10002, USA

reviews.text: Good overall! Good food and nice server. It was a little loud (though it was a Saturday night) and tables are packed in tight.
Very delicious ramen! And the waiters are amazing too. Highly recommend!
Service is always such a pleasure! Cheers to Johnathan! Vegan shoyu was delicious
Fast & Great Service to go
Love this place- best ramen place in the city
Every dish was excellent

Very noisy. Can barely talk to each there.
Super salty good.
Very good
Amazing ramen and buns and cool atmosphere
Absolutely love it here. Best place to get ramen in the city
We love Ivan's Ramen, but we were wondering why the cauliflower appetizer was taken away from the menu, which was one of our favorites!
Attentive service and very fast ğŸ’šâ€¦
Definitely will be back! Great experience
Davvero un bel locale, con una atmosfera vivace arredato con gusto, ramen strepitoso e servizio molto cortese. Assolutamente da provare.
Excelente !!
Awesome place. Hope they bring the curryflower again to the menu.
this place is insane just go in and have a chicken paitan with spicy pickled at the bar. you won't regret it
A gem of a spot- great food and a fun vibe! Save room for the sweet potato pudding!
Great service. Incredible food.
Jose was an amazing server.
Chicken piatan for the win!
Had lemon shrimp and crispy eggplant for appetizers - they were sooooo good! Wasnâ€™t impressed by the chicken paitan ramen though.. will come back to try a different ramen!
Incredible service, perfect meal!

We were charged â‚¬45 for a â€œno-show,â€ even though we had both called and received email confirmation that we would not be charged. We called about six hours before our reservation to ask for two extra seats, and when that wasnâ€™t possible, we confirmed the cancellation. The staff assured us by phone â€” and later by email â€” that there would be no fee.

Despite this clear confirmation, the charge was still made. Weâ€™ve also emailed twice since then with no response. Very disappointing.
Yummy !!
Super tasty and good service. Will come back again for sure.
I was here in 2019 first time and it was the best ramen in NYC. And today I can confirm same. Great quality, we enjoyed it!!

Ivan Ramen offers a refreshing take on a classic dish. The noodles were firm with a unique flavor, likely from a different flour blend, and stood out from any ramen Iâ€™ve had before. The broth also had a creative twist that felt light and clean without losing depth. I had the spicy miso and i think there is mala in there.. the different spice profile is well balanced.Itâ€™s a great example of how you can deviate from tradition and still deliver something just as satisfying as the original. Service is good - the staff is very attentive. Restaurant lighting is a little too dim imo.
Sehr leckeres Ramen.
Excellent as  always

This is my third or fourth time here. Itâ€™s always a great time, no matter the time of day or week. I came for lunch today and tried their new spicy veggie miso ramen and itâ€™s honestly some of THE BEST ramen Iâ€™ve had in the area and city. As a noodle lover Iâ€™m always pleased when a place continues to elevate their menu.

Ivan Ramen (yes, the Chefâ€™s Table legend!) did not disappoint, chicken broth has been simmered for 8 hours, smooth yet silky, soft-boiled egg stirred in for that velvety touch, noodles with a perfect chewy bite. Crispy chicken skin + scallions on top = flavor bomb . And I loved those roasted tomatoes! Skin crackly, tangy-sweet and refreshingâ€”such a genius twist! Will definitely return.

Incredible food. The guys were also really helpful when my friend had certain allergy requirements. Ask for them to suggest the must haves. I loved the signature chicken ramen with noodles. We also had the pastrami buns and eggplant. So so so good.

Amazing ramen! Had the spicy miso one. Very rich broth and the spice blend to the point with a divine garlic touch. Yet it was more of a Mala noodles to me. Noodles were perfectly cooked (a bit thin for my taste tho).
Will come again for the tonkotsu.

Absolutely exceptional Ramen. The appetizer of the crunchy chicken was really yummy. The Ramen was a whole other level of ramen Iâ€™ve never had before. I got the Ramen with the crispy chicken on top. It was out of this world.

Spectacular all around!
Everything we tried was delicious. The seaweed kimchi was phenomenal, the ramen - out of this world (every single spoonful and every bite was divine), very interesting n/a drinks and the smoothest cheesecake. Very nice staff. We got there at around 3:45 p.m., and it was nearly empty. Food was served very quickly, and it's very convenient that you can pay through the QR code on your table. We were also really surprised by how low the prices were compared to the quality they offer! If we lived closer, I would eat there every day! Can't wait to go back!

DELICIOUS!! My friend is a regular and brought me here the chicken paitan was so good that even a week later I remember the taste of the dish. The tuna appetizer and potato salad were good, but the highlight is definitely the ramen. Came in around 8:30pm on a Thursday and sat down immediately.

Appetisers were amazing, and service too! A bit of a disappointment as my Tokyo Shio ramen was very porky (yes, its a thing) and I wouldn't recommend it. Tonkotsu ramen was good, but nothing to write home about.

After watching Chef Ivan Orkinâ€™s Chefâ€™s Table episode in 2017, I knew I had to try Ivan Ramenâ€”and it did not disappoint. The restaurant is a trendy, welcoming, and casual spot with incredible service. Our waiter was knowledgeable and guided us through one of the most delicious meals I've ever had. Since eating here, I haven't had ramen that even comes close to his.

This is a must stop spot in NYC!

Been wanting to try this restaurant and it was AMAZING!
Very welcoming, friendly, casual yet professional/knowledgeable staff. Super tasty food. Vibrant and modern dining area.
I will be back for more. â¤ï¸ğŸ‘

super attentive staff!!

we got the tonkotsu and jiro tonkotsu ramen and both came in huge portion! the soup was very thick and noodle was just chewy right at the sweet spot. they have a small outside, backyard seating area that is quite nice too (no a/c though)

there were some cool drinks/desserts on the menu but we were too full to get, will come again next time!

(Last visited June 4, 2023.) Hanging out in NYC with some friends and we were on the lower east side this time. We were walking down the street and the incredible umami smell of ramen wafted our noses so we decided on Ivan Ramen! Here's how it went.

Atmosphere/Appearance: This place may look a little small, but there's a lot of space in here in separate compartments. It was SUPER busy so we did have to wait a little bit, but it wasn't too bad. It was nice outside so we actually went IN to the restaurant then out like, a side door to another outdoor section that was so beautifully setup. It was quieter outside (naturally) and just felt nice to eat outdoors, but not be sitting right next to the street.

Service: I can't remember who took care of us, but I don't remember having any issues at all.

Food: We started off with their Wagyu Pastrami Buns which is a concoction of house-made pastrami, sauerkraut and japanese-russian dressing. These were delightful! Rich, meaty, creamy and a lil' crunchy due to the sauerkraut. Well-executed. We then tried Ivan's Karaage which is crispy fried chicken, lemon, and choice of sauce: yuzu-kosho mayo, black garlic honey, shiso buttermilk, or yuzu-chili sauce. Of course we went with the yuzu-kosho and this too was delightful! Crispy, crunchy, tender chicken that was rich in flavor! For my ramen/bowl entree I decided on the Triple Pork Triple Garlic which is a less soup-y style of ramen made with a tonkotsu broth, shoyu-braised pork chashu in two ways. My goodness this was off the chain! Hot, tender pork, rich, salty broth and excellent balance with textures. Well-done.

Value: It's New York City. I mean, you know the deal. Each of our appetizers were $14.00 and my ramen was $20.00. Not bad at all to be completely honest. That's extremely reasonable and worth every penny!

In conclusion, I'd absolutely pull up here again and get these exact things! Of course I'd love to try some other menu items as well! Check this place out if you can get a seat!

Ivan Ramen is a must-visit for anyone looking to experience ramen like never before! Thanks to a friend for bringing us here and encouraging us to watch the Chef's Table episode featuring Chef Ivan Orkinâ€”a moving story that resonates deeply and is worth watching (grab a tissue and watch before you go!)

We went on a night when the Blackbird special was going on, and the ramen was half-price through the app. We ran into some issues with the app, but luckily a representative was there to help. Even though we couldn't get the app working correctly, Ivan Ramen still honored the deal. Great service!

Ivan Orkin's dedication to creating a unique culinary experience distinctly shines through in the food. The ramen I enjoyed was absolutely the best I've ever had, even compared to my time in Japan. I savored the chicken ramen, enhanced by roasted tomato, and it was nothing short of spectacular.

Accompanying the ramen, we had a delightful serving of the Ivan Karaage, which was beautifully crispy and flavorfulâ€”a true highlight of the meal. On our plates but not pictured were the scrumptious miso Caesar salad and a refreshing daikon salad, both of which complemented the meal perfectly.

Everything about our dining experience was exceptional, and I can't recommend Ivan Ramen enough for anyone looking to enjoy an authentic yet innovative take on ramen!

Update: had to go back again, added some more photos.

I can only eat chicken broth-based ramen and their tori paitan is one of the best I could find in the city!! They also topped it with some crunchy chicken skin. We also had sesame noodle with roasted tomato add-on, it was lil spicy, but so good! Also, this place was on Netflixâ€™s Chefâ€™s Table Season 3, years ago. The place is still popular, we came on Friday night and it was packed. Might be better to reserve.

Ivan Ramen delivers a bold and unforgettable dining experience that perfectly blends Japanese tradition with New York creativity. From the deeply flavorful Triple Pork Triple Garlic Mazemen to the lighter yet satisfying Tokyo Shoyu Ramen, every dish is crafted with precision, personality, and top-tier ingredients. The noodles are springy and fresh, the broths rich and layered, and the small plates, like the tofu caviar and fried chicken buns, offer playful, delicious surprises. The vibrant, casual atmosphere and genuinely enthusiastic staff create a welcoming vibe that makes the meal even more enjoyable. While it's a bit of a splurge, the quality and inventiveness more than justify the price. Ivan Ramen isnâ€™t just a good ramen shop, itâ€™s a must-visit culinary destination in NYC.

AuÃŸergewÃ¶hnlich!
Durch Empfehlung sind wir auf Ivan Ramen gekommen. Ein auÃŸergewÃ¶hnliches Lokal, mit traditionellen und auch sehr kreativen Gerichten. FÃ¼r die warmen Temperaturen im Sommer war, waren die kalten Sesam Nudeln eine tolle Wahl. Service war sehr sympathisch und hilfsbereit. Definitiv ein Restaurant, dass wir wiederkommen mÃ¶chten. .

The ramen is simply amazing. We also had the potato salad (topped with smoked trout roe) and miso ceasar...so good!

The service was very friendly. The place is packed work tables in a somewhat dark cozy space but clean and comfortable. The vibe here was vibrant.. music a little loud but we could talk

Food was excellent. The Mariâ€™s potato salad was a solid starter, simple but tasty. The real standout was the schmaltz-fried gyoza â€” crispy, rich, and packed with flavor. I liked it so much I ordered an extra to go. The chicken paitan ramen was also great, especially the broth, deep, flavorful, and satisfying.

My recent lunch at Ivan Ramen was nothing short of extraordinaryâ€”probably the best ramen of my life!

We arrived during lunch hours and were pleased to find it wasn't overcrowded, allowing for a relaxed dining atmosphere. The staff greeted us warmly and took time to explain their signature dishes, demonstrating both knowledge and passion for their menu.

We started by sharing a pork bao which was absolutely succulentâ€”tender, flavorful, and the perfect appetizer to set the stage for what came next.

For our main course, we ordered two different ramens: one with chicken broth and one with pork. The chicken ramen was the standout starâ€”just too good! Every spoonful revealed complex flavors that had clearly been developed with care and expertise. The pork ramen was also excellent, showcasing the versatility of the kitchen.

The restaurant's thoughtful approach to traditional Japanese cuisine with innovative touches makes it a must-visit destination. We've already marked it on our map, and on our next trip to NYC, we will definitely be stopping there again!

If you're a ramen enthusiast or simply looking for an exceptional dining experience in New York, Ivan Ramen should be at the top of your list.â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹

Muy bueno. No fue necesario hacer reservaciÃ³n, el servicio fue muy bueno y atento. Una chica hablaba espaÃ±ol y fue sÃºper linda. La comida increÃ­ble, excelente sabor, nos sirvieron muy rÃ¡pido y definitivamente el ramen es buenÃ­simo. Pero cuidado cuando dice â€œspicyâ€ porque en muy muy muy picoso ğŸŒ¶ï¸

Ramen as itâ€™s best, pork broth.

Modern web based menu, and you can pay bill online as well, very positive about it.

Went on a Thursday night for dinner. Food was AMAZING. Two of us got the tonkotsu ramen and the third the vegan ramen. We all loved our dishes. Would highly recommend the spicy garlic chicken appetizer as well as the combo where you can get 3 small bites for $16 - the potato salad was the best Iâ€™ve had and the asparagus with the stracciatella changed my life.

However, the hostess was rude and unfriendly - told us there was a 45 min wait, when we went back (put our names down), she told us we were next. When a table cleared a few minutes later, she sat down another group that had also been waiting while ignoring us. So, it ended up being about 75 minutes to get seatedâ€¦ And then we didnâ€™t even get a table, but rather the bar/stool seating. That aside, the service (our waiter) was speedy and lovely.

Overall would come back but recommend MAKING A RESERVATION, even for weekdays!

Perhaps I was too hyped for this, otherwise this spot may have lost it's original charm. The ramen ... was ramen. Nothing particularly interesting, but nor is there anything to critique. I struggle to understand what makes this "Ivan" cuisine. The rye noodles don't add anything to the dish. There was nothing particularly standout with the ramen either. It is a bowl of meat, veggies and noodles in lard soup.

Come here if you want a safe bowl of ramen. The interior is well decorated as well. Loved the wallpaper.
Everything is delicious but the Chicken Paitan was the star of the night. If possible, treat yourself with the pumpkin cheesecake.

O MELHOR RAMEN DE NYC ğŸœ
Estivemos hoje no Ivan Ramen e saimos jÃ¡ pensando em voltar! Ã‰ sem dÃºvidas uma das melhores comidas que jÃ¡ provamos. Nas fotos coloquei o nome dos pratos, amei todos, especialmente as gyozas, o tonkotsu ramen e o yuzu cheescake, que estava PERFEITO!!! Os ramens foram dicas de um dos atendendes e estavam deliciosos!! Os preÃ§os tambÃ©m sÃ£o bons.
Como nÃ£o reservamos mesa ficamos no bar, mas nÃ£o houve problemas e nem espera (fomos numa terÃ§a-feira). A comida sai rÃ¡pido e Ã© deliciosa. Tanto o menu quanto a conta vocÃª acessa por QRcode e pode pagar facilmente pelo celular. FuncionÃ¡rios simpÃ¡ticos e prestativos! Indico com certeza esse lugar! ğŸ«¶ğŸ¼

Very friendly service, excellent food!
The spicy ramen was delicious and definitely 8/10 spicy but awesome flavor.

The Gyoza was top 3 Gyoza I have ever had.

Highly recommend!

Ivan Ramen is a must-visit spot in NYCâ€”whether youâ€™re a meat lover, vegetarian, or vegan, there are options for everyone. The atmosphere is stylish and lively, with great music that sets the tone. The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive, making sure your experience is tailored to your preferences. The food is outstandingâ€”rich, flavorful, and setting a whole new standard for ramen. From now on, whenever I crave truly good ramen, Ivan Ramen is my go-to.

Tonight we had dinner at Ivan Ramen, and it turned out to be a really enjoyable experience. The place isnâ€™t particularly fancy or cozy, but it has a warm and friendly vibe. The layout is narrow and long, which gives it a bit of a New York charm. The decor is simple yet pleasantâ€”nothing extravagant, but tastefully done. The staff were welcoming and made the atmosphere even more comfortable. We started with the eggplant appetizer, which was absolutely delicious and full of flavor. The ramen was outstanding â€” rich broth, perfectly cooked noodles, and balanced toppings that really stood out. Every bite felt thoughtfully made and satisfying. Even though the space isnâ€™t large or luxurious, the food easily makes up for it. Weâ€™ll definitely be coming back soon for another bowl.
Incredible as always! Wish theyâ€™d keep the daikon on the menu but the eggplant, triple pork triple garlic, and chicken paitan are perfect every time!

There are a few of these located around the city.   This one serves the LES.   Good food.  Small portions.  Nice staff.   Outdoor seating in the back is available.   Reasonably priced.   Card payments are accepted.   Give this place a try if youâ€™re in the area.   We will definitely be going back.

Thank you to the owner for responding. I look forward to trying your other locations.

ESJ

Excuse my photo of my half eaten meal. I ordered the Tokyo Shio and I quite liked it as the soup was balanced (not overly salty as some places do). Our server was really friendly and nice, even gave us recommendations of his favourite spots in the neighbourhood!
We were surprised about how it easy it was to get a table so last minute on a Friday night! Food was great, portions generous and price level very fair!

Bravo! What a great experience - you can taste the quality, care and love in every bite!

Worth the trip - my wife and I are going back to San Francisco full and happy!

Hats off to Chef Orkin and team
Great spot, love that the ramen is actually spicy just wish the cilantro flavor wasnâ€™t as strong and there was more meat on the chashu vs fat but still good ramen overall. Got the spicy miso ramen!

202505

Shaby neighborhood, low key restaurant. Lots of locals. Fabulous food and atmosphere.

Ivan Ramen in the Lower East Side was a fantastic choice for dinner. The Cold Sesame Noodles were fresh and delicious, the beer selection was excellent, the laid-back atmosphere made it easy to enjoy, and the service was spot on.
